body_html:
Many thanks @Menerve and @zhubofei
Summary:
After installing tensorflow-gpu and trying to import it in python I also got the Segmentation faults. First had to add the /Developer/NVIDIA/CUDA-8.0/lib as well as /Developer/NVIDIA/cudnn-8.0/lib to DYLD_LIBRARY_PATH in the bash_profile, and then needed to rename libcuda, with "sudo ln -sf /usr/local/cuda/lib/libcuda.dylib /usr/local/cuda/lib/libcuda.1.dylib"

As a newbie in library dependency issues I would like to ask you all: how do naming issues like with the libcuda.1 happen?
